data.title: Awesome every visit.
data.text: I go to Black Knight at least once a month - usually on Reggae Sunday for $3 Red Stripe and unlimited chicken wings for $10.  It's in my neighborhood and just a fun place to hang out.  The service is always fast and efficient.  We usually sit outside on the patio which is perfect to hear the music and people watch.  My only concern is parking at The Triangle.  It is very difficult to find a spot to park and at times we are forced to valet.

data.title: Not for older adults
data.text: This is a happening place for Millennials.  Loud music on weekends.  Jam packed with lots of drinking and less eating.  Very popular with the younger folks.  Food is average.  They do have Taco Tuesdays.

data.title: What a yummy find!
data.text:
Two visits for brunch. Two terrific experiences!  Extremely reasonable brunch menu!  Both visits I opted for their Crab Cake Benedict and my wife their Bacon Waffles. They were not only extremely tummy but at $12 and $5 respectively a genuine bargain!  $7 Brunch Cocktail specials top it off. The BK Bloody Pint is an extremely tasty version of a Bloody Mary complete with a mini grilled cheese and slice of bacon in addition to the normal  accouterments. $7 "Cup of Joe" with pick of poison is also a great deal!   They advertise other weeknight specials that look to be very good as well!  
We are looking forward to our next visit!

data.title: Hot Wings & Cocktails!
data.text: Quick pit stop for a drink and nibbles. Fast friendly services. Reasonable prices and plenty of outdoor seating.

data.title: Dinner review
data.text: The food was great... but the highlight of our visit to the restaurant was our server Ann Marie....  Very pleasant and professional..  we are from out of town and she took the time to write down several recommendations of places for our group to visit!!  Hat Off to you, Ann Marie and also to Black Knight!!!!

data.title: Fun place for Sunday Reggae!
data.text: A neighborhood staple on Sunday afternoons.  Great wings and Red Stripe beer!  Awesome service and entertainment.

data.title: Gastro Pub ?? whats that...its GREAT , thats what it is!
data.text: Amazing how good the food can be at this Gastro Pub. it starts with the quality of food they are preparing and they have trained the Chefs to make it right. Great place for Cocktails, Wine Wednesdays, and their House Taco's are Spectacular...and what other place has all you can eat Spagetti. Wow. I love this place and the Bar staff is Outstanding. Bravo to the Owner who created this place. its Great for Brunch or Friday night Beers. live entertainment occasionally also is pretty cool.

data.title: Fun venue
data.text: We visit Black Knight often.  Try to go during the week for their daily specials or on Reggae Sundays - Red Stripe beer for $3 and $10 all-you-can-eat wings.  Other than that, it is a bit expensive.  It's a fun place to gather with friends.  I recommend sitting outside.  You can people-watch to your heart's content or watch the many big-screen televisions.  Food is good but not the best.  I believe the pizza is better than most.

data.title: Best Tacos
data.text: This place is cool to hang out just with the atmosphere.  They play good music, have a excellent outside patio area.  The greatest thing was how good there tacos are.  Some of the best I have ever experienced.  Also these tacos are only $1.50 and are not small.

data.title: Great reggea Sunday but don't go for the food
data.text:
This is a nice bar and lounge with plenty of TV's that show sports. We went for Upstream, the local reggae band that plays there on Sunday afternoons from 2.30 p.m. - 5.30 p.m.
It has a nice atmosphere with inside and outside seating. The service very friendly all though a bit disorganized. So you have to be a patient guest. The food is mediocre. We were a group and we have been here a couple of times. The food was never really good. But then it is very reasonably priced and you get what you pay for. 
So in a quick summary: Go there for the music and the drinks but don't expect to much from the food. We will go back anyway. I can still recommend this as a fun place to go.

data.title: Local pub crashes into Gastro Grub
data.text:
I almost haven't wanted to review this local treasure, so I it doesn't get even busier. As a bar, it's cheap, strong cocktails and cheeky, cute barmaids. The staff is so friendly, it's easy to over indulge so eating is necessary. It's a 21 and over bar that happens to serve great food.
I have yet to eat anything I wouldn't order again. It seems like typical bar fare at first, until you read the ingredients. Marinated chicken breast with fresh mozzarella, basil, tomato and pesto. The bread is spectacular. It appears to be a squarish torpedo roll, but, it's almost flat. The outside crust is extra crisp and what there is of the inside roll perfectly holds the sandwich together. This same bread is used on the Italian (prosciutto, ham, salami) and meatball.  The sandwiches come with regular shoestring fries or sweet potato, a good slaw or a super creamy potato salad like I get in Hawaii. 
The appetizer and pizzas are all generous and like the rest of the menu, reasonable. A decent charcuterie includes salami, prosciutto, jams, assorted cheese and crostini. It's a great deal at $12. I thought the $12 price was high for potato skins considering the cheap eats on the menu. Until, four is us were served a dozen giant, loaded plate of crispy skinks.the staff is clever and always comes with the condiment tray in hand. Pepper plant, Sirracha, Tapatillo are always available.
I refuse to share the nightly specials, but I can tell you the $1 sliders and $1 tacos are enticing and delicious.
